s.text: Your final number would be suspect in a hundred ways.
That's relatively easy to observe, and it gives yet another measure of how much people dislike this particular level of risk.
Your final number would be suspect in a hundred ways.
But until you've done some kind of analysis, quoting a number such as "10" is both dishonest and disreputable.
(Or, so we don't get too deeply sidetracked into your personal idiosyncrasies, how the guilty going free or the free getting convicted might affect the lives of your neighbors.)
Suppose you want to know just how unpleasant it is to face a 1 percent chance of a $100,000 loss.
Then all you have to do is look at those people who face a 1 percent chance of losing their $100,000 homes in a fire and see how much they are willing to pay for fire insurance.
